page.title: 02Kippax Area (cont)...
page.content: Mining was established in the 13th century and by the 16th century had become a considerable industry although many of the local pits have closed down. The majority of families in the area are still involved in mining however and most are at Ledston Luck pit which is still open, but there are plans to close this in the near future. The village began as a few cottages lining Main Street but has rapidly expanded during the last ten years with new housing developments making Kippax virtually an overspill of Leeds. This has caused some friction between old 'Kippaxers' and the 'newcomers'.
